N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 836.3 - Hearing officer

State Regulations
(a) Generally. Hearings shall be conducted by one or more members of the commission, by the
executive director, or by such other hearing officer as the chairman may
designate, except as provided in subdivision (b) of this section. (b) Waste load allocation cases. In cases
involving the allocation of the assimilative capacity of a stream: (1)

The executive director shall appoint a
hearing board of at least two persons. One of them shall be nominated by the
water pollution control agency of the state in which the discharge originates, and he shall be chairman. The board shall have and exercise the powers and
duties of a hearing officer: (i) a quorum of
the board for purposes of the hearing shall consist of two members; and
(ii)
questions of practice or
procedure during the hearing shall be determined by the chairman. Notes
